intro: Alseodaphne khasyana, commonly known as the Khasi alseodaphne, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green on top, with a lighter underside. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by egg-shaped berries that are typically dark purple when mature. This species is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland to hill forest areas.
